intro: Psychotria venosa, commonly known as the velvet psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers. It is often found in forest understories and is known for its ornamental value in horticulture. Psychotria venosa is also notable for its role in traditional medicine and as a host plant for certain insect species.
